description: This file contains a shell script used for managing syslog and log files, including functions for archiving, compressing, restoring, and initializing syslog configurations, as well as handling various log files related to system events and firewall logs.

methods.name: old_sysevtlog_handle
methods.description: Handles creation and archiving of system event log files, including zipping and managing unique filenames.

methods.name: old_fwlog_handle
methods.description: Merges and moves old firewall log files into a new archive, handling file size and old log cleanup.

methods.name: start_syslog
methods.description: Initializes syslog configuration, sets log levels, and ensures directories exist.

methods.name: get_log_file
methods.description: Fetches the log file path either from syscfg or sysevent, with fallback to configuration files.

methods.name: remove_log
methods.description: Removes specified log files and their directories.

methods.name: compress
methods.description: Compresses syslog, eventlog, or fwlog files into bz2 archives with file rotation and cleanup.

methods.name: uncompress
methods.description: Restores compressed log archives into specified directories.
